conclusion: To determine whether Car A is ahead of or behind Car B at t = 10 seconds, we need to analyze the areas under the velocity-time (v-t) graphs for both cars from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement of the car.
Car A's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 40 m/s over 10 seconds.
The graph forms a right triangle with the time axis for Car A.

premise: The base of the triangle is 10 seconds, and the height is 40 m/s.
conclusion: The area (displacement) of a triangle is given by: Area = 1/2 × base × height.

premise: Substituting the values: Displacement of Car A = 1/2 × 10 s × 40 m/s

conclusion: Car B's velocity increases linearly from 0 to 20 m/s over 10 seconds.
The graph forms a right triangle with the time axis for Car B.

premise: The base of the triangle is 10 seconds, and the height is 20 m/s.
conclusion: Using the area formula for a triangle: Displacement of Car B = 1/2 × 10 s × 20 m/s

premise: Substituting the values: Displacement of Car B = 1/2 × 10 s × 20 m/s
At t = 10 seconds, Car A has traveled 200 meters. At t = 10 seconds, Car B has traveled 100 meters.
conclusion: Since 200 meters (Car A) is greater than 100 meters (Car B), Car A is ahead of Car B at t = 10 seconds.
